title: Sarong, ca. 1930
medium:
Medium: silk, gilded paper?
Technique: tied resist patterning in weft (ikat) on plain weave with continuous supplementary weft patterning
description: Sarong with deep borders at each end with bands of various widths containing geometric floral-like motifs. Two narrow borders at each side with stripes perpendicular to those in the body of the sarong. The field patterned by an all-over fine diamond lattice. Gold patterning on a ground of reds and violets. The ground of the side borders is changed by warp stripes and the bands in the end borders and the ground of the entire field by a change in the color in the foundation weft or weft ikat.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sarong, ca. 1930.Medium: silk, gilded paper?
Technique: tied resist patterning in weft (ikat) on plain weave with continuous supplementary weft patterning. Gift of Alan L. Wolfe. 1969-50-2.
